meanings.definition: A book with a flexible cover made of paper.
meanings.sent1: I love reading paperbounds because they are lightweight and easy to carry.
meanings.sent2: She picked up a paperbounds novel from the bookstore.
meanings.sent3: Why did the paperbounds book go to the therapist? It had too many issues!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library of paperbounds, each book representing a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The paperbounds book felt like a friend, always there to provide comfort and escape.

meanings.definition: To bind or cover with paper.
meanings.sent1: He decided to paperbounds the report to give it a professional look.
meanings.sent2: The students were asked to paperbounds their notebooks for the new school year.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to paperbounds itself with the wrapping paper, thinking it was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was so strong, it seemed to paperbounds her heart with his name.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully paperbounds the edges of the canvas before starting the painting.
